A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: A painfully obvious attempt to kill the existing Star Wars franchise and capitalize on the newer millennial crowd. This disjointed\, trope-ridden action snoozer is filled with Disney's perceived social injustices that just HAVE to be righted\, coupled with far too many \"What in Gods name am I watching?\" moments. \n\nAside from a wholly irrelevant 30 minute subplot that demonizes the rich\, the premise of the movie is based on the assumption that the entire First Order armada has been utterly thwarted by a Resistance ship that travels just a little too fast at sublight speed. That's right folks\, we're supposed to believe that the First Order built a planet-gun fueled by actual stars\, but can't figure out how catch or destroy a single resistance Resistance ship. Drat.
